articles.headline: FAA database provides quick history
articles.summary: A piece discussing the use of FAA's service difficulty reports following the USAir Flight 427 crash, highlighting NICAR's role in providing data to news organizations, and addressing the challenges and shortcomings of the database.

articles.headline: When the numbers look too good to be true
articles.summary: An article detailing the investigation into FAA service difficulty reports on Boeing 737s after the USAir crash, revealing inconsistencies in data reporting and questioning the reliability of the FAA database.

articles.headline: Asbury Park Press exposes voting fraud
articles.summary: An investigation into voter fraud in New Jersey using the Social Security Administration's Death Master File to uncover deceased individuals who are still listed on voter rolls, and in some cases, continued to vote.

articles.headline: Tapping into the power of databases
articles.summary: An exploration of how computer-assisted reporting can enhance science journalism, with case studies on toxic chemical investigations and university medical research funding.

articles.headline: Covering the computer beat
articles.summary: A guide to investigative reporting on the acquisition, use, and oversight of computer systems in government agencies, covering contract structures and the trend of outsourcing.
